overview:
Fernando has been a web designer for more than 10 years working for several web design studios and creative agencies.

In 2000, at age 14, he created PuertoBaires, a small freelancer design firm where he worked for small, medium and big companies focusing on user interface design and usability. His work was awarded on several occasions by companies and universities.

By 2007 he founded Cowork Central, the first coworking space in Latin America, a shared office space designed for freelancers and/or independent workers located in Buenos Aires, Argentina.

Later, in 2008, he co-funded BlueFever, a digital marketing agency specialized in interactive design projects. One year later he left the company in pursuit of a personal project.

In mid-2009 he co-created Bettween.com, a small app that allows people to track and share conversations within Twitter’s users. He is actively involved in the project up to this date.

He is also freelance consultant working for web development and design agencies in the US and also works for Citrusbyte LLC as the UX and visual lead designer.
